channel.title: Beauty Pageants
channel.description:
Although the poll is highly biased in favor of the death sentence. Do you believe these parents are in the wrong when forcing their children to whoreify themselves?
A little kindle to get the fire burning http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/20/maddy-verst-dolly-parton-custody-toddlers-tiaras_n_1812317.html
[img]http://weknowmemes.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/kill-it-with-fire1.jpg[/img] [img]http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BEbikBd9_xQ/TmifSvA9hiI/AAAAAAAADoQ/A39iKE2Jl08/s1600/vote-yes.jpg[/img]

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

sinisoul:

Toddlers in Tiaras makes me rage.

And the funny thing is, my girlfriend actually enjoys the show. I just want to shove her in the closet sometimes…

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Being overweight wouldn’t be a problem if we were all outside burning calories day in and day out.

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Just as much of a problem as wanting to be unnaturally skinny. Just because being overweight is easy doesn’t mean its exactly ‘natural’ to a certain extent

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell:

Dont you think the pressure to gain “enough” weight could exist also?

There might be a pressure, but is that a problem?

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:24, topic:455252”][quote author=Niall link=topic=558152.msg4084772#msg4084772 date=1345704520]
just because they aren’t average doesn’t mean they aren’t healthy re: dove advert, they don’t necessarily look fat or overweight
[/quote]
… But the Victoria secret models ‘could’ be healthy also[/quote]
It doesn’t matter at all. They could all be perfectly healthy, but it doesn’t matter. If they become a role model for girls, the harm is done.

Read full topic

item.description:

Niall:

just because they aren’t average doesn’t mean they aren’t healthy re: dove advert, they don’t necessarily look fat or overweight

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I much prefer natural beauty to a shit load of makeup and what not. Regardless of the size of the women, I believe beauty takes more forms than just looks. Bigger girls can be beautiful too, it’s just whatever ticks with you in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named

just because they aren’t average doesn’t mean they aren’t healthy re: dove advert, they don’t necessarily look fat or overweight

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:20, topic:455252”][quote author=Frell link=topic=558152.msg4084385#msg4084385 date=1345667737]
No I mean its stupid as hell to find some shirtless scrawny fuck “hot” because he has 1 situp a week worthy abs and a beiber haircut
[/quote]
So the requirements of hotness for you is big muscles?
Good that you touched that subject, while those people you talk about doesn’t suffer from any problems, there is a problem for someone. Bigorexia/Muscle dysmorphia is a problem for some guys, and might increase when such a view as yours become normal.[/quote]
No you understood that wrong, and I think I said it a bit wrong. If they don’t exercise why take your shirt off in the first place to pose? And no, muscles aren’t required, just don’t flaunt what you don’t have This isn’t so much as a media issue as it is with me going ??? wtf when im reading facebook.

We see the same thing on both sides. Fat girls wearing short shorts etc.

But to balance the beam I think overly buff guys are nasty as hell and freakish.

But like you said, I guess everyone prefers something. Emo girls like weirdly skinny guys and the same way in reverse lol. But ‘overall’ its completely mixed what people like.

Here you can see a prime example of media fighting, completely leaving out the average.

The Victoria secret models make me cringe, while the Dove models aren’t “average” either. Though this is an American campaign so it may be the American average.

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell:

No I mean its stupid as hell to find some shirtless scrawny fuck “hot” because he has 1 situp a week worthy abs and a beiber haircut

So the requirements of hotness for you is big muscles?
Good that you touched that subject, while those people you talk about doesn’t suffer from any problems, there is a problem for someone. Bigorexia/Muscle dysmorphia is a problem for some guys, and might increase when such a view as yours become normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

No I mean its stupid as hell to find some shirtless scrawny (I mean bone-rubbing Ethiopian-style) fuck “hot” because he has 1 situp a week worthy abs and a beiber haircut. You almost question if taking his shirt off and posing for the picture was actually necessary. Though I see this trend lessen even more as they get into highschool.

not really a mental social media issue, just idiots on facebook “omg he r so cute look dose abs” THOUGH I have seen a handful of girls comment on those viral ‘like’ posts that sort of side with my view. And most of these pictures im seeing from my sister and her friends, fresh out of middle school which is the absolute heart of media influence.

But actually in a way I think it could be an issue. Average guys don’t have abs, but they don’t look like skeletons. The tumblr fags may be starving themselves just to have abs starting from a young age and not even realize it. Low bodyfat is more effective at showing your abs than exercise.

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell:

Theres alot of girls that like those stupid facebook ‘tumblr boys’ posts that are just skeletons with abs

Is there a pressure among boys to be skinny?

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:455252”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=558152.msg4084248#msg4084248 date=1345655052]

It is wrong for all ages.

I dont think its an issue for teens+, but most people are ugly as fuck when they enter a beauty pageant vs their normal look. Its no different than body building comps. Get a haircut that suits them, be clean and exercise and theres a good chance their opinion will change.

Girls today is feed with the beauty propaganda, this only fuel all the health and psychological problems that girls today have.
[/quote]
Am I the only one who thinks Victoria secret models look like skeletons and aren’t pretty at all?[/quote]
I have formed no opinion on them, as I don’t see them.

Read full topic

item.title: Beauty Pageants
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“ggallin, post:8, topic:455252”][quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=558152.msg4084004#msg4084004 date=1345616871]
Many may or may not agree with this, but it’s as simple as, if you don’t like it please leave and if you do please support. Many parent’s feel like they may be setting their daughters future up in this industry but, honestly my opinion…

DaFuq.
[/quote]
sadly all the kids in these pageants either end up, 12 and pregnant, hookers, meth addicts, and transvestites.[/quote]
transvestites? uh… how would this effect the female sexuality in that way? do you have proof for all of what you stated; or are you just spewing bullshit again?

anyway, i think it’s disgusting.

Read full topic
